texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I found a Plesk 8.3 server running RHEL 4 last month that was presenting errors when users attempted to send e-mail via SquirrelMail:
texts.text: I found a Plesk 8.3 server running RHEL 4 last month that was presenting errors when users attempted to send e-mail via SquirrelMail:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
ERROR:
Email delivery error
Server replied: 127 Can't execute command '/usr/sbin/sendmail -i -t -fsomeuser@somedomain.com'.
texts.text:
ERROR:
Email delivery error
Server replied: 127 Can't execute command '/usr/sbin/sendmail -i -t -fsomeuser@somedomain.com'.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The error was appearing because safe mode was enabled and SquirrelMail was unable to drop e-mails into /usr/sbin/squirrelmail. After disabling safe mode on the server, the users were able to send e-mails via SquirrelMail.
texts.text: The error was appearing because safe mode was enabled and SquirrelMail was unable to drop e-mails into /usr/sbin/squirrelmail. After disabling safe mode on the server, the users were able to send e-mails via SquirrelMail.
